posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Upgrade to 2023.4.1 on both the client and server sides.

Peter_Johnson:

client

Are you saying that Shuffleboard needs to be updated too?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Yes.  Use the WPILib installer to update desktop apps.

posts.name: Aaron Huang
posts.cooked: I’m still having problems with packet loss/disconnect

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Severe enough packet loss can cause reconnects, yes.  There’s a one second timeout if data backs up too much.  Are you actually able to maintain a DS connection through this much packet loss?  If it’s happening only with one laptop I would recommend looking at that laptop’s wireless card, other processes running bogging down the cpu, etc.

If it’s only happening with one laptop I’m not so certain on this but especially if you have a bunch of side tasks running or the problem is bad this can happen.

If you’re sending more then a hundred fields over network tables and you’re updating them as fast as possible with a subscription speed of 0 for example even on extremely good hardware entries begin to skip and packet loss becomes a massive problem, if this really is the issue you might have to either find a way to change subscription rate or switch to a dashboard that supports a feature like that such as ico or this advantage scope fork although I’m sure there are other dashboards too with the feature those are just the two publicly available ones I’ve worked with this season and I bring this up as a potential issue since my team ran into it ourselves and found this to solve the problem. Hope this can help.
